page.title: 05KEMBERTON VILLAGE AMENITIES
page.content: Apart from the village hall and public house there are few amenities. There is a small post office but the only shop in the village closed last year. There is a daily milk delivery and a mobile shop comes once a week. Most people do their shopping in Telford Town Centre or ar Madeley, Shifnal or Bridgnorth. A shoppers' bus runs to Bridgnorth on Wednesdays and Saturdays and to Telford Town Centre on Tuesdays. The village does not have a doctor and most people go to Shifnal or Madeley for medical treatment. The village school closed 21 years ago. Primary school children usually go to Beckbury or Shifnal. The secondary school for the village is also at Shifnal. Buses are provided for children who go to these schools. The village has a mobile library and there is a newspaper delivery each evening.
